headline: The Anti-AI Trade Is Red Hot. Here’s What’s Beating Artificial- Intelligence Stocks.
summary: Investors fleeing hard-hit software companies are taking comfort in stocks that might not get disrupted as much by the artificial-intelligence revolution.  Analysts at Goldman Sachs noted in a report Tuesday that a basket of European companies it considers capital-intensive has outperformed capital-light stocks—in industries such as media, retail, business services, and software—by 35% since 2025.  Airbus BMW Volkswagen Nestle Diageo  and ASML were some of the companies in Goldman’s capital-intensive basket.

headline: ASML's Systems Sales Grow in Double Digits: What's Ahead?
summary: ASML Holding's system sales rise 12.4% in 2025 as AI-driven logic and memory demand lift EUV adoption, with a robust backlog.

headline: Applied Materials Awards Suppliers for Outstanding Performance
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., Feb. 24, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Applied Materials, Inc. today announced the recipients of Supplier Excellence Awards for contributions made to Applied’s business over the past year. headline: Anthropic joins OpenAI in flagging 'industrial-scale' distillation campaigns by Chinese AI firms
summary: Anthropic accused three Chinese artificial intelligence enterprises of engaging in coordinated distillation campaigns, the latest American tech firm to do so.

headline: Samsung HBM4 AI Push Meets Fair Value And High Expectation Risks
summary: Samsung Electronics has begun industry first mass production and commercial shipments of its HBM4 DRAM for AI and data center workloads. The company is supplying advanced foundry technology to partners such as SEMIFIVE for one of the first commercially viable fully homomorphic encryption accelerators. Samsung has also joined as a founding partner of Applied Materials' EPIC Center to support advanced semiconductor R&D and process development. For investors watching KOSE:A005930, these moves...

headline: Applied Materials (AMAT) Is Up 5.3% After Strong Q1, Export Deal And 2nm Push - Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: In February 2026, Applied Materials reported first-quarter fiscal 2026 results showing sales of US$7,012 million, sharply higher net income of US$2,026 million, and basic earnings per share from continuing operations of US$2.55, while also issuing second-quarter revenue guidance of about US$7,650 million plus or minus US$500 million. Alongside these results, the company launched new transistor and materials engineering systems for 2nm-and-beyond chips and closed a US$252.5 million U.S...
